subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
author: Eric VanDuzer
full_text:
maybe our spirit is a hacker


On Wed, May 20, 2009 at 4:24 PM, Rj <rasterer@...> wrote:

>
>
>
> Manipulating EMF is one thing.  But directly storing bits on a media is way
> beyond that.  Bits are not stored in a continuous stream.  They are broken
> into bytes (little packets) that is totally controlled by the processor and
> software.  For Elvis to "encode directly" to the media, he would have to do
> what that software does to the digital signals coming in from the AtoD
> converter: he would have to group the bits into (for example) 16 little
> herds each, decide on the specific bit interpretation scheme (2's
> complement?),  find space on the media, update the media's dictionary of
> where there is free space and where there isn't, link the herds together
> with some sort of linked pointer, skip around the areas marked 'bad' on the
> media, update things like date/time modified and size, respect any kind of
> ownership permissions on the media, and so on.
>
> It is much more credible for the signal to be manipulated near the AtoD
> converter (where EMF changes would have the most straighforward result) than
> in the digital media itself.
>
> --- On *Wed, 5/20/09, April Abercrombie <
> april@...>* wrote:
>
>
> From: April Abercrombie <april@...>
> Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
> Date: Wednesday, May 20, 2009, 1:05 PM
>
>  ﻿
> "Probably not "directly", since that would mean grandma would have to have
> quite an understanding of digital encoding, including which bits mean what,
> when, and where."
>
> Not necessarily- maybe it is that just by trying to communicate through our
> equipment, it happens automatically. They don't have to realize that they
> are manipulating the EMF to make it occur, it just happens. It's the nature
> of being of pure energy.
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> *From:* Rj <http://mc/compose?to=rasterer@...>
> *To:* EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com<http://mc/compose?to=EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com>
> *Sent:* Wednesday, May 20, 2009 1:55 PM
> *Subject:* Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
>
>
> Probably not "directly", since that would mean grandma would have to have
> quite an understanding of digital encoding, including which bits mean what,
> when, and where.  But even on a digital recorder, there is still an analog
> element (the Analog to Digital converter) which takes the sound pressure
> waves, as represented by some analog electronic detection element, and
> converts that into digital.  That way, long departed uncle Ebenezer does not
> need to do anything digital.  Under this scenario, if sound is not being
> heard in the room, but is being induced into the circuitry, then it would be
> round about that AtoD converter (assuming it isn't other just plain old
> noise in the digital elements).
>
> Someone with more electronic know-how than me might be able to better
> pinpoint the area in the analog portion of that AtoD pipeline where it would
> be most likely it could be influenced by, say, an EM field, and that would
> also occur in a normal analog tape recorder.
>
>
> --- On *Wed, 5/20/09, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch.
> com>* wrote:
>
>
> From: April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh ostresearch. com>
>
> Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
> To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
> Date: Wednesday, May 20, 2009, 12:29 PM
>
>   This is what I think true EVP is Eric. Not and actual sound emitting a
> sound wave in the environment, but EMF manipulation in order to imprint the
> message directly to the recording media. It doesn't matter if it is analog
> or digital.
>
> If the sound that is recorded emitted a sound wave in the physical
> environment, then it is really a disembodied voice, and not true EVP.
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> *From:* Eric VanDuzer
> *To:* EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
> *Sent:* Wednesday, May 20, 2009 11:16 AM
> *Subject:* Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
>
>  Actually that I would buy into  But the question I have when you say
> "tape" are you talking old analog tape or digi recording.  Here is the
> reason I believe it can be do "real-time".  As you all know we use
> electromagnetic Field detectors in field investigations.  If a spirit can
> manipulate that with to show that they are there by giving off a EM field
> whose to say they can't manipulate a magnetic strip of a tape or even the
> electronics in a Digi recorder to speak in "real-time".
>
> On Wed, May 20, 2009 at 1:01 PM, Kristin Morris <ckmorris95@sbcgloba l.net
> > wrote:
>
>>
>>
>>  Okay I have another one for you to think about.. I tape a session and
>> review it later..  even a day later.  Upon review the message that comes
>> over is about something that ‘just happened’ while I was reviewing or
>> happened after taping?  Is it possible that spirit can manipulate the
>> recording AFTER recording has stopped or even manipulate the audio while
>> reviewing?
>>
>>
>>
>> An give you an example of this I was recording one day and I reviewed the
>> audio the next day.  While reviewing – about half way through – the message
>> “Your mother is calling” was found.  I saved it and moved on and within two
>> seconds my mom called.  You say it is a coincidence except that I hadn’t
>> spoken to my mother in over a year.  During this same conversation with her
>> – we sorta made amends and I told her the story of the ‘secret’ I had found
>> out about a family member having a child out of wedlock in the late 1920s.
>> Quick backstory.. I found out about this out-of-wedlock birth through my
>> genealogy research and contacted spirit through the box and I was promptly
>> told to keep it secret and which I promised to do…
>>
>>
>>
>> Well in this conversation with my mom after not speaking for a year I told
>> her what I had found out.  When the telephone conversation ended with my
>> mom… I was amazed that the recording had told me she would call right be
>> fore she did – even though the audio was recorded the previous day.  I
>> proceeded to go back to reviewing the audio and the very first thing I heard
>> was:  THAT WAS SUPPOSED TO BE A SECRET – YOU LIED.
>>
>>
>>
>> Maybe they can manipulate ‘real-time’ literally??? ?
>>
>>
>>
>> k
>>
>>
>>  ------------------------------
>>
>> *From:* EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com [mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com] *On
>> Behalf Of *April Abercrombie
>> *Sent:* Wednesday, May 20, 2009 11:36 AM
>> *To:* EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
>>  *Subject:* Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
>>
>>
>>
>>
>>
>>
>>  2 different things happening-that' s why. When you get EVP that everyone
>> understands,  it is outward, in the environment. Not a communication through
>> subconscious means.
>>
>>
>>
>> EVP that people swear they hear, but noone else can make sense, may be a
>> message to them via subconscious means. That isn't to say that ALL EVP's
>> like this are true messages, I am sure alot are just matrixing.
>>
>>
>>
>> But then that is how the art of scrying starts-matrixing. Like the
>> Rorschach tests. The images you matrix with those gives the psychologist an
>> insight into your mind.
>>
>>
>>
>> By gazing into a dark, reflective surface, you start to see cloudy images.
>> At first, you will just be matrixing faces in the clouds and not getting
>> much substance. Try it, you will see what I am saying. With practice, you
>> start to see clear, concise images.
>>
>>
>>
>> I think that is what happening with audio as well.
>>
>>
>>
>> We already know for a fact pareidolia can occur in audio as well as visual
>> stimulus.
>>
>>
>>
>>  ----- Original Message -----
>>
>> *From:* Eric VanDuzer
>>
>> *To:* EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
>>
>> *Sent:* Wednesday, May 20, 2009 10:19 AM
>>
>> *Subject:* Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
>>
>>
>>
>> yes I understand its personal to that particular individual but why can't
>> I hear it.  I have gotten some very personal EVPs through the traditional
>> investigation way (not through a box or anything of that matter) that all
>> others have heard.
>>
>> On Wed, May 20, 2009 at 12:15 PM, April Abercrombie <april@abercrombiegh
>> ostresearch. com> wrote:
>>
>>
>>
>> "If one person is not meant to hear it they won't hear it (I guess I am
>> not quite ready to believe that one right yet)."
>>
>>
>>
>> I don't know for sure about that one either, but I am not ready to
>> discount it either, especially since I stumbled across the possibility of
>> audible scrying. But I am sure alot of people don't believe in scrying at
>> all either.
>>
>>
>>
>> What makes it a possibility to me is that so many people are hearing
>> things that are very personal, but stuff they would not have come up with on
>> their own.
>>
>>
>>
>>
>>
>>  ----- Original Message -----
>>
>> *From:* Eric VanDuzer
>>
>> *To:* EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
>>
>> *Sent:* Wednesday, May 20, 2009 10:09 AM
>>
>> *Subject:* Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I have a question.
>>
>>
>>
>> I think that is the problem I am having though Jim.  When you say "work
>> them over till you hear them"  to me I should not have to work them over
>> till I hear them.  Yes taking out the ambient and background noise is one
>> thing.  But if you just keep on listening to them with different
>> enhancements you are bound to hear something (matrixing).  If one person is
>> not meant to hear it they won't hear it (I guess I am not quite ready to
>> believe that one right yet).  I think you all know what I am getting at.
>>
>> On Tue, May 19, 2009 at 9:11 PM, James W. Hyslope <clockdryve@yahoo. com>
>> wrote:
>>
>>
>>
>> Well, for myself...I don't "clean" them up to much because I really don't
>> know HOW :) (well a little bit)Since I've only been at it for a couple
>> weeks. BUT if you can clean up something to where you can FIND what was
>> there to begin with "you have done no harm" I hear alot more than others I
>> guess, and I haven't enhanced many of my evp's.*If anyone is able to clean
>> them up...I DO promise you will hear what I say is correct)Pretty BOLD
>> statement, but if you are able to clean it up with better software (please
>> do for others too) I will be more than happy to "listen" where I made a
>> mistake...I can only LEARN from it :) I have done some DEEP enhancements to
>> a few of my evp's...from the begining I could only hear clicks and
>> thumps.....but after messing with that area, eventually I would hear the
>> true voices (and can tell if male or female...approximat e age) and
>> understand the mood also....these where extreamly modified, and I feel that
>> I could NOT have added enough "simple" enhancements that would ADD a
>> voice....full of emotion and distinct syllables :) And some just can't hear
>> them for what ever reason be it equipment that is used to hear
>> (pc-headphones- speakers- ears) know one has the perfect match of all these
>> things. Check out "Jim's RR-DR60 EVP's" in the files section....work them
>> over till you hear them. I really can't do much more :)--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups
>> .com, Eric VanDuzer <evanduzer@.. .> wrote:
>> >
>> > Now I may be biased to the "investigation" way of doing things. I do
>> clean
>> > up evps if I hear something and can't make it out do to ambient noise.
>> So
>> > hear is my question. When do you stop cleaning up? Wouldn't to much
>> > enhancing "taint" the results? To me the more enhancing you do the less
>> > convincing it becomes. I hope noone finds this offensive, it is not
>> meant
>> > to be I am just really curious. The way I look at it is that if you have
>> to
>> > do so much enhancing to find anything, was there really something there
>> to
>> > begin with. Are we just making ourselves believe there is something
>> there??
>> >
>> > Eric
>> >
>>
>>
>>
>>
>>
>>
>
>
>  
>
